revised_title: Meteorological Observations and Phenomena in 18th Century Europe
tldr: This article presents meteorological observations and phenomena from various locations in Europe during the year 1726. The author, W. Derham, discusses the weather patterns, barometric and thermometer readings, and the occurrence of auroras and other natural phenomena. The observations were made at Berlin, Lunden, Bettna, Sweden, Upsale, Bygdea, and Pithea, and provide insights into the climate and weather conditions of the time.
